intro: Chaenorhinum calycinum, commonly known as the blueweed or sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to saline environments. Its blue to violet flowers bloom in summer, adding a vibrant touch to its habitat. The leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
